Package com.team1.Auber

Class MapRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.BatchTiledMapRenderer
      • com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer
        • com.team1.Auber.MapRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.maps.MapRenderer, com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMapRenderer, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    public class MapRenderer
extends com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer
    The map render. Extended OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer and then added functionality to detect whether walls, and healing etc

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapRenderer

        public MapRenderer​(com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap map,
                   java.lang.String strMap)
        Create the map render and convert the string representation for use in collision detection.
        Parameters:
        map - A titled map object that contains the visual representation of the map
        strMap - A string representation of of the map (from a file), using numbers. Each tile is a number with what each number means being set above

                     float w,
                     float h)

        w - width of rectangle
        h - height of rectangle

      • Effect

        public boolean Effect​(int effect,
                      float x,
                      float y,
                      float w,
                      float h)
        return true if every tile the cordinates rectangle are in is a effect tile
        Parameters:
        effect - the effect you are looking for e.g 2 for heal. (set in class variables)
        x - the x coordinate of rectangle relative to the world
        y - the x coordinate of rectangle relative to the world
        w - width of rectangle
        h - height of rectangle
        Returns:
        boolean if the rectangle is in a effect square
